name: Blackheath Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an outstanding hotel! Having read the previous reviews on the Blackheath we went there expecting something special and we were not to be disappointed.
reviews.title: A superb hotel!

reviews.text: Much has already been said about Antony's personal service, but the amount of care and attention to detail was quite astonishing. Advice on restaurants (even going so far as to make the bookings and taxi reservations) and help with travel arrangements are all part of the hospitality. Yet, at no point is this hospitality overbearing. Highly sensitive to his guests differing needs, Antony is a host par excellence. Though it may sound a bit of a cliché, guests are made to feel that they are visiting a friend's home. What a refreshing change from all those large hotels we stayed in when in South Africa.
reviews.title: An Absolute recommendation

reviews.text: Internet access is free, drinks are available (you hardly have to ask!), DVD and cable TV in each room and the most comfortable beds you could ever hope to sleep on.
reviews.title: Sooo want to go back !!!!

reviews.text: This is a great guest house in a very central location.This place felt like home, very relaxed and friendly.They have a lovely veranda overlooking a pretty garden and pool which is a relaxing place to sit and have a glass of wine during the evening or to have breakfast.The staff are very helpful and friendly and Anthony was a delight! Very helpful.
reviews.title: Great all rounder

reviews.text: We stayed at quite a few guest houses over a 2 week period and some were much more expensive than this one.Blackheath was in my view the best value for money with comfortable and good sized rooms.The bed was absolutely perfect.Can't wait to go back next year!
reviews.title: just great!

reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for a night in Feb 2008. Staying at Blackheath Lodge is like staying in the luxury home of your good friends. From the moment you arrive, you feel looked after and welcome, and no request (information, directions, advice, restaurant reservations) is too onerous for Ant, one of the guesthouse’s two owners. Blackheath Lodge consists of two adjacent houses on the slopes above Sea Point, overlooking the Atlantic. The décor is relaxed but elegant, with touches of African style. The bedrooms are spread throughout the two original buildings and the nerve centre is the lovely courtyard with its lush plants, and the sparkling blue swimming pool, which provides a sheltered oasis even on windy days. Drinks and breakfast are served on the tranquil wraparound verandah under crystal chandeliers - all exceedingly lovely.
reviews.title: Blackheath Lodge is a gem

likes.liked: — Location, beautiful room & buildings, excellent service

reviews.text: Our light and airy room was on the first floor and had a panoramic view towards Lion’s Head, as well as a window looking directly down the hill towards where the ocean. The room was huge and very well-equipped with a king-size bed and particularly lovely linen; a selection of drinks and nibbles; a TV and a small library of DVDs; and a seating area. The bathroom was also large and the shower had panoramic views over Lion’s Head - hard to tear yourself away, really!
reviews.title: nothing was too much trouble!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast the following morning was served on the wraparound verandah overlooking the pool - we ate at a slightly raised table under a small crystal chandelier and felt like visiting royalty! From the small buffet you could choose from a selection of cereal, yoghurt, fresh pastries, fresh fruit, mini quiches, a cheese board and a fruit tart. In addition, we also had eggs of our choice cooked to order and a bottomless cup of excellent coffee.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great for tourists as you are close to the V&A Waterfront as well as beaches and restaurants. There is free off-street parking (with a security guard at night) if you are driving yourself, but alternatively the lodge will be happy to arrange taxis for you, and they can also arrange an airport shuttle to collect you on arrival for an additional fee. In South African terms (R495 per person per night incl. breakfast), it is not budget accommodation, but if you are paying in foreign currency it starts looking tremendously reasonable (about £33 pppn), and what you get is outstanding value for money. This is a place I would definitely return to!
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Our stay was excellent, the hotel was very nice and clean and our room had everything we could need. The breakfasts were amazing. what made our stay particularly special was all the effort made by anthony tand all the other staff to make us feel welcome and offer us suggestions and hint and directions - nothing was too much trouble!
reviews.title: Lovely Lodge

likes.liked: — The style of the house - the reception

description: Blackheath Lodge is a Victorian guest house situated below Signal Hill, a stone's throw from the city, Waterfront and well-known beaches. Stylish bedrooms, excellent personalized service and warm hospitality. Enjoy breakfast on the terrace overlooking the pool and garden. Come home to a sundowner after a busy day of sightseeing or power business dealings, safe in the knowledge that a quiet, comfortable night's sleep awaits you. Airport transfers. Credit Cards. Children 14+. TGCSA 4-Star Guest House.
